Description: Neck sherd of Attic black-figured pottery ovoid neck-amphora; interior glazed black; exterior: part of vertical zigzag on left; black-figure male head (beard but no moustache; added red on hair, remaining) to left.
Producer name: Attributed to: The Painter of Vatican 309
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 224, no. B74)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0029) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 92, pl. I, no. 35)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
